description:
Have you ever wondered what Canada’s oil patch says behind closed doors? DeSmog had an opportunity to attend an energy and natural resource forum hosted by the Greater Vancouver Board of Trade, and in contrast to its public messaging emphasizing carbon capture and storage (CCS), oil industry leadership instead called for less regulation, more extraction […]

The post CAPP President Abandons ‘Net Zero’ Message at Exclusive Industry Event appeared first on DeSmog.
title: CAPP President Abandons ‘Net Zero’ Message at Exclusive Industry Event

description:
This article was originally published by PublicSource, a nonprofit newsroom serving the Pittsburgh region, and is supported by the Pulitzer Center. One morning in late September, on the shores of Lake Erie, Toby Rice took the stage before a room of fracking executives and gas industry types working in the Marcellus Shale.  “I was in New York […]

The post EQT’s ‘bulldog’ has D.C. in his grip, with profits — and maybe higher gas bills — on the horizon appeared first on DeSmog.
title: EQT’s ‘bulldog’ has D.C. in his grip, with profits — and maybe higher gas bills — on the horizon

description:
DeSmog is excited to announce the promotion of Geoff Dembicki to the position of Global Managing Editor. Geoff is an award-winning investigative reporter, author, and long-time friend of DeSmog since we first discovered his excellent reporting and shoved a copy of Climate Cover-Up into his hands in 2010. His 2022 book, The Petroleum Papers, was […]

The post DeSmog Announces Geoff Dembicki as Global Managing Editor appeared first on DeSmog.
title: DeSmog Announces Geoff Dembicki as Global Managing Editor
